section.title: Past simple
section.sectiontitle: We use the Past simple to talk about a finished action in the past. We usually say when it happened.
section.text2a: My mother always took me to school when I was young.
section.sectiontitle2: We can also use the Past simple for a state in the past.
section.text3a: We lived in a very small house in those days.

section.title: Past simple
section.sectiontitle: In the positive, we usually use subject + verb + - ed/-d/-ied.
section.text1a: We started at ten o'clock and finished at five.
section.text2a: I loved music so I studied it at university.
section.sectiontitle2: In the negative, we use subject + didn't + verb.

section.title: Past simple
section.sectiontitle: In the question, we use did + subject + verb.
section.text1a: Did they win the match? Yes, they did.

section.title: Past simple
section.sectiontitle: We use I/he/she/it was and you/we/they were to make the past of be. In the negative, we use was/were + not.
section.text1a: I was fifteen when I met Jenny.
section.text3a: Was he at work? Yes, he was.
section.text4a: Were you at home last night? No, I wasn't.
